prompt: <description>Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top and a Flat Bottom Sketching the Curved Top Surface 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the given euler angles and translation vector. This will define the placement and orientation of the part. 2. Draw the top surface of the part as a sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Create two loops in the sketch. The first loop should start with a line segment from the point (0, 0.667) to the point (0, 0.75), followed by a series of line and arc segments that connect the points (0.2201, 0.75) with (0.1574, 0.667), (0.1539, 0.6594) with (0.2936, 0.4998), and (0.2421, 0.4704) with (0.198, 0.4704). The loop should end with a line segment from (0.1464, 0.4704) to (0.1464, 0.1911) and another line segment from (0.1464, 0.1911) to (0.0, 0.667), which will close the loop. 4. The second loop should start with two line segments from (0.0525, 0.6439) to (0.145, 0.5382) and (0.145, 0.5382) to (0.1485, 0.5366). Then it should continue with two arc segments that connect the points (0.1485, 0.5366) with (0.2192, 0.5366), (0.2192, 0.5366) with (0.1301, 0.65), and (0.1301, 0.65) with (0.0559, 0.6516). The loop should end with two line segments from (0.0559, 0.6516) to (0.0525, 0.6439) and (0.0525, 0.6439) to (0.029, 0.0735), which will close the loop. 5. The two loops form a curved surface. Constrain the loops to be tangent to each other to ensure that the surface is smooth and continuous. Sketching the Flat Bottom Surface 6. Draw the bottom surface of the part as a sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 7. Create one loop in the sketch. The loop should consist of four line segments that connect the points (0.029, 0.0), (0.4112, 0.0), (0.4112, 0.0735), and (0.029, 0.0735). 8. The loop forms a flat surface. Sketching the Straight Side Surfaces 9. Draw two additional sketches on planes defined by the coordinate system. One sketch should be for the left side surface that is perpendicular to the curved top surface, and the other sketch should be for the right side surface that is parallel to the curved top surface. 10. In each sketch, create one loop that consists of two line segments that connect the end points of the top surface with the corresponding end points of the bottom surface. Extruding the Sketches 11. Extrude each sketch separately to create three-dimensional solids. The top surface should be extruded by a distance of 0.0294 units, while the flat bottom surface should be extruded by a distance of 0.0294 units. The straight side surfaces should be extruded by a distance of 0.0735 units. 12. Combine the extrusions to form a single solid body, which will represent the final shape. The resulting solid should have a rectangular prism shape with a curved top surface and straight side surfaces. The height, width, and length of the solid should be as specified in the description.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Create a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: length - 0.75 units, width - 0.75 units, and height - 0.25 units. The base of the prism is attached to the coordinate system's origin. 1.1. Define a coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 1.2. Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the defined coordinate system with a single face. 1.3. Add the following lines to the sketch, forming a rectangle: - Line 1: Starting Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Starting Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.07] - Line 3: Starting Point [0.75, 0.07], End Point [0.0, 0.07] - Line 4: Starting Point [0.0, 0.07], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 1.4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. 1.5. Apply the given euler angles and translation vector to transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. 1.6. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.25 units. Part 2 Generate another rectangular prism on top of the first one with the following dimensions: length - 0.75 units, width - 0.75 units, and height - 0.22 units. 2.1. Define another coordinate system for this task with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.04, 0.0] 2.2. Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system with a single face. 2.3. Add the following lines to the sketch, forming a rectangle that intersects with part 1: - Line 1: Starting Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Starting Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.04] - Line 3: Starting Point [0.75, 0.04], End Point [0.0, 0.04] - Line 4: Starting Point [0.0, 0.04], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 2.4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. 2.5. Apply the given euler angles and translation vector to transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. 2.6. Perform a cut operation on the first intermediate CAD part using this scaled 2D sketch, extruding it along the negative normal direction (opposite normal) with a depth of 0.22 units. The resulting shape will be the final cad assembly model as per the given JSON data.</description>
